website_summaries.verdict: This timing light tool can take the place of 3 different pieces of equipment in 1.
pros: Easy to hook up and operate
Can read voltage and dwell angle
Offers extra functions including indicators for advance timing, dwell timing, voltage readings, and tachometer readings
cons: Not really tough enough for a professional setting, but certainly a great model with a lot of features for home use

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a year ago. Had a heavy duty light for about 25 years that I had thrown away thinking I would not ever need a timing light. Ended up getting a classic car, so I looked for a good light. This one got pretty good reviews so I bought it. Used it maybe 5 times over the course of the year. Not ever dropped, mistreated or mishandled. Started smoking and stopped working. Went into the trash bin. Too flimsy for me, even as a shade tree mechanic. Will not repurchase this or any Innova product. I'm moving on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool but I have an issue.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this is a great little tool. Seems built well and easy to use. The drawback for me? The pickup is totally erratic. I have new wires, new plugs, new cap and actually a whole new engine. It seems that the pickup doesn't grip the wire (8mm) tight enough to get a solid signal. If I use one hand and twist the pickup on the wire, it works much better but I need both hands for other adjustments. I have tried to use it several times with the same results. If I could clear up this issue, I'd give it 10 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A good piece of equipment for tuning old school hot rods.
customer_reviews.text: Instruction book could be MUCH more thorough. Instructions on outside of box are much more detailed, do NOT lose the cardboard sleeve box. Takes a bit to understand the buttons, but they do make sense. The ability to see the RPM's while changing static and "full in" timing are very nice features. Connect tool before starting car. Make sure all wires are safely away from moving parts. I used cable ties to avoid the fan and the a/c compressor. The green tach/coil wire has to go along way across the engine on my car so I was cautious. There are YouTube videos to help you understand the tool.
customer_reviews.author: The.Jag.Man

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to use. I wish there was a way to change the number of spark pulses it reads per rev, because the Miata I used it on has a wasted spark system where it fires two spark pulses per cycle. Until I figured that out by reading an online forum I was trying to set my idle at what I was reading on the timing light as 850 rpm, but what was in reality 425. Once I figured I needed to basically read double on the light, it worked great. Did not try the spark advance feature.
customer_reviews.author: J. Huesmann

customer_reviews.title: Strobe malfunctioned in first 5 minutes of use
customer_reviews.text: Just used the Innova 3568 timing light for first time this morning. Worked fine for first 5 minutes then strobe light would not come on. Checked timing light on another vehicle with same result. Unfortunately, I had purchased this product over a year ago and didn't even open the packaging until this morning. Contacted customers support who indicated I could send it in for servicing. Cost of service with postage is about the cost of a new one. Company policy applies one year warranty to date of purchase. No exceptions. Based on this experience, I will not purchase another Innova product.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado-Cosmo

customer_reviews.title: Typical Chinese Product
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed is the advance dial turning counterclockwise completely off the scale and stopping far away from zero. I've owned timing lights since 1973 and this is the first one I've seen where the dial doesn't stop exactly on zero. At best this will be accurate within 3 or 4 degrees. At worst, who knows? If you want your engine correctly timed, I suggest looking elsewhere if all of these are made like the one I received. It's going back to Amazon because it IS NOT a professional quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: 5string

customer_reviews.title: Great product but no instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the case, I found only a poorly written “Quick Start” page with no real instruction book. I called the tech help number but they were closed on Sunday. So I figured it out myself and used it. It worked great! I check accuracy of voltage and it was right on. The digital ROM readout on the timing light made the tune-up very easy as the idle could be quickly adjusted iteratively with the timing since they both affect each other. The next day I was able to download the real instructions from their website.
customer_reviews.author: John Bradley

customer_reviews.title: worked great for 10 mins then broke
customer_reviews.text: worked great one time. was able to measure dwell too and it was just too cool. setting total timing was a breeze having the rpm gauge built into lcd. lights stopped working not long after. so at that point it was useless. thank god for return within30 days. wish this company would just charge a little more for a better quality product. i wouldnt mind paying 300 dollars if i knew it was made in USA with quality parts. its a shame how dependent we are on china. companys make more money outsourcing vs making America a better place with more US jobs
customer_reviews.author: Johnmorella90

customer_reviews.title: INNOVA 5568 Pro-Timing Light is Amazing underhood tool - replaces 4 other devices
customer_reviews.text: wow- one underhood device you can operated one-handed to read rpm, timing, dwell, & volts while your other hand is working the throttle or adjusting the dizzy position; due to various reviews i was skeptical when purchasing but love it! It replaces my Snap-On dial back, tach/dwell meter, & DVOM all at once ; regarding other reviews be aware they are not all about this model 5568 - it is worth every extra $$ to buy this one -
customer_reviews.author: emoze

customer_reviews.title: spark pickup
customer_reviews.text: i saw a number of reviews that stated they had trouble with the light showing the proper RPM. I bought this and had the very same problem. I called Innova's support and found out that none of their lights are compatible with MSD units. My car has an MSD box and the light shows 5-6k RPM at idle. I didn't see anything in the description or comments about this issue so i thought I'd post it here. Not saying this is causing all the negative reviews but it is certainly an issue for some of us. otherwise I guess it's an OK tool.
customer_reviews.author: C. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Why timing light fails after a month of not being used?
customer_reviews.text: Simple to hook up and use! However it failed a month later when I tried to check timing again on my motorcycle. Connections are properly connected and strobe light only flickers if on/off button is pushed several. Does not work on my auto as well! Does not pay to order online, this type of equipment. The Induction Clamp has tape on the inside, so not sure what that is for, other than to protect wiring. That is not mentioned on the part description! So what could the problem be? Hard to know also when the strobe light is on or off, using the red push button!! Model 3551. Still light new but not functional!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Works on two stroke motors
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1984 Mercury 75 hp two stroke outboard motor. I needed this for the sync and link. This is one of very few that will do tach and timing on two strokes. The tachometer feature is questionable. I was able to tune the motor to full power with it. This kind of technology is on the way out. So you are limited with choices. This did work and I would buy it again. I don't know if there is tech support? The instructions were vague at best. I went on U tube for instructions.
customer_reviews.author: charles lozano

customer_reviews.title: Great light for the price but the signal cord could use more shielding
customer_reviews.text: Seems to pick up interference from surrounding wires (using on an msd driven ignition though). If I leave the pick cord near the other spark plug wires it will impact the timing. When I lift it away and clear of interference, its solid and the advance dial is a great addition! The signal line really needs more shielding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOA. Just didn't work from moment one.
customer_reviews.text: DOA. Never worked out of the box. Only shows voltage. No RPM, no dwell, no light, nothing. Connected exactly according to instructions. Used many timing lights in my 19 years of turning wrenches. Good thing for the refund policy. This light wasted a lot of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good timing light (and more) with some minor flaws
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My only gripes are that it should come with better instructions and the inductive clamp for the sparkplug should be able to withstand more heat. I made the mistake of getting it too close to the exhaust header and it deformed and started malfunctioning. I had to buy a new set of wires as their customer service refused to cover it under warranty. I know it was partly my mistake but I have worked with other timing lights and haven't had this issue before. Still, a good product that is easy to use and offers a lot of functionality in one package. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: surfgeek

customer_reviews.title: ONLY WORKED ONCE
customer_reviews.text: WORKED OK THE FIRST USE EXCEPT THE FLASH WAS NOT CONSISTENT. THE SECOND USE IT DID NOT FLASH AT ALL, I HAD TO PAY FREIGHT TO SEND IT BACK FOR REPAIRS, HOPEFULLY IT WILL BE OK WHEN I GET IT BACK. I WILL NOT BE PURCHASING THIS BRAND AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: REALITY  CHECK.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not ideal for DIS
customer_reviews.text: Works really well but keep in mind this one doesn't have a dial, so you need to really know what you are doing to make it work for you. Not ideal for any DIS (distributorless ignition system) as many harmonic balancers don't have proper timing marks for your TDC +10 -10 and it will only be able to tell you if you are getting "fire."
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice but be sure it supports your engine or ignition.
customer_reviews.text: Timing light seems nice for the price however be aware that it does not have a 2/4 stroke selection switch and will not read the proper RPM on any double fire engines (Wasted Spark) which includes GM DIS Ignitions, and of course excludes 2 strokes. The RPM shown is double the actual RPM. Sure, you can divide it by two but if your doing testing for stall speeds or trying to get quick readings it's a pain to try and divide by two on the fly. Other than that, the light seem very brite and the tach was accurate and steady (except for twice the RPM).
customer_reviews.author: Richard Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Novice-ready. After paying big moola for half-hearted or fake attempts to time the car, I decided to try it at home. Using one short YouTube video, the specs sticker on the vehicle, a bottle of white-out, a distributor wrench and this basic timing light I finally got it timed correctly in broad daylight. It might not last forever but it has already paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice... very bright pulse light...
customer_reviews.text: my only complaint, which is not the tool's fault, is that is battery connect instead of cordless... so on my 24v gas compressor ignitions I must have a single 12v spare battery handy to hook it up to... but I love how bright the beam light is even in the brightest daylight peering into a small dark Cat 3306 bell-housing port...!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Boutelle

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced, quality is good, can't complain
customer_reviews.text: Works great, seems accurate compared to a Craftsman digital one I had borrowed from someone before buying this for myself, quality is actually nice especially for the price. Really can't complain. No it's probably not going to survive you smashing it on the ground or running it over with a truck but just take care of it and it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Ramsay

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working the second time I used it. Which was also 1 day past my return date for Amazon. Cable is fine. Still reads RPMs. But the light itself no longer works. Had to go buy a Harbor Freight one to finish working on my truck. I bought "top of the line" model hoping for a long life product. Not use twice in a month and throw away 100 bucks model
customer_reviews.author: Larry Ratliff

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: Very basic timing light. Bought it to adjust timing on 1994 Mazda Miata. Easy day, nothing fancy, just does the job that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Unsatisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Though I gave it 4 stars because it didn't actually come with a case like is shown in the pictures
customer_reviews.text: Have not tested it out yet but it seems promising. The light section moves from the angle in the picture to straight for different angles in the engine bay. Though I gave it 4 stars because it didn't actually come with a case like is shown in the pictures. I cancelled an order for a nicer one because I thought this one came with a case. But the actual product seems solid.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Flexible Timing Light
customer_reviews.text: I used this to check timing on a Kohler twin cylinder engine. I like the versatility of this electronic ignition tool. It is much more than just a timing light. It is easy to check RPM, Voltage, Ignition Timing and Dwell Angle. The real work is getting the ignition specifications for industrial engines.
customer_reviews.author: MartnGale

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I used this to time my 1992 TBI Small block Chevy 350 motor in my 1995 GMC Sierra. Finally after finding the timing advance wire on my truck (which was a brown wire with a black stripes behind my glove box). This plugged right up, super simple and worked great. My engine is now running much better. Great price
customer_reviews.author: Stirm

customer_reviews.title: Good timing light
customer_reviews.text: Good timing light. I have always used a snap on timing light, my last one stopped working after fifteen years. I was very happily surprised with the good quality look of this timing light. It works very good has a bright light and all the functions I need plus more. The only little issue that I had is the chord pulls out of the light very easily, I like the removable chord feature but it needs to stay locked in place until removed. It is a very good light and functions very well that is why I gave it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely. Read manual First...
customer_reviews.text: A little over priced but overall is good. Good bright strobe light. Articulation of head is nice. Digital readout is great. good light just don't use it allot but a needed purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael on the hill

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE # 5568 PRO INNOVA TIMING LIGHT
customer_reviews.text: liked nothing about it. It never worked . Rip off ; It never worked the first time I tried it and no directions came with it. I had to call tech support before I used it and they weren`t the greatest ;They wanted 89 dollars to look at it , plus shipping. It`s junk ,
customer_reviews.author: don dahl

customer_reviews.title: Innova don't stand behind there products
customer_reviews.text: Screen went blank flasher intermittent. I used once then second time don't work. Was out of warranty. Innova would not stand by the product and wanted $90 plus shipping to fix. Last time I buy Frome them. Stuff breaks no problem but it was used once . Junk
customer_reviews.author: guess who

customer_reviews.title: Multiple failures
customer_reviews.text: I bought this timing light specifically for the advance feature. It worked for the three or four times I used it. But the next time it was intermittent. I traced it down to the cables. I order new cables and it worked the first time but now the advance feature doesn't work. I'm really disappointed and can not recommend this light.
customer_reviews.author: Old Norm

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for any shop
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product delivered in new packaging. Delivery time was less than expected. The 5568 timing light is very easy to use. Gives a handy voltage reading as well as a tachometer with back lit display. I have used it to set timing on a 91 Z28 1LE 5.7 tpi. Removed the aftermarket Hypertech chip and timed it with this. The Camaro runs better than before. Better midrange power and pulls harder throughout the RPM range. Thanks again to Amazon and their flawless shipping policies. Andy
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my Harley’s
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I use it for timing several Harleys. Turns a two man job in to basically a one man job. Doesn’t come with a case, which would be nice. That’s the only reason I have it 4 stars and not 5
customer_reviews.author: Nick Read

customer_reviews.title: Snap-On function, budget price.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it needs to, it's accurate and pretty well built. Had it for a while now, and it's helped with three different built engines, haven't had an issue with it. Installed a scan tool to see what my ECM was reading, and the timing light's little display with my scan tool were pretty much spot-on.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, not ideal for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: works. Would be nice if the head was shorter, a little tricky to aim at the TDC marks on a BMW MC (which are between the front wheel and the engine on the front of the engine.) Advance dial-in is nice but the button skips ahead multiple numbers quick if you don't punch and release crisply. Kinda expensive but only one that has these features. Also not ideal for MC engines (which have 1/2/3 cylinders), you have to fiddle with the settings to get the right RPM and advance numbers (my bike has 3 cylinders, I had to goof around some and pick the 2-cycle setting).
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Dave

customer_reviews.title: Can’t complain for the money!
customer_reviews.text: For a cheap timing light it’s great. Not sure I would use it to make a living but to keep the junk in my garage running as best as possible awesome bang for the buck. I did give 5 stars to tech support but I have never used them. Figured that was more fair than giving them bad stars.
customer_reviews.author: Nkrell3

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely recommended if you work on older cars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic device! Very simple and very cheap. Also, it works flawlessly. The light is slightly dim, so make sure to work in a shaded spot as the sun will be brighter than this.
customer_reviews.author: Julius M

customer_reviews.title: Accurate device
customer_reviews.text: This is the premium model sold by the manufacturer and the only one that is sold with a case. It appears to be well built. I have used it to time a 1989 GMC truck. It is a great tool to tune up older model vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Woks Great
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I had no issues using it. I just wish I would have ordered the one that includes the rpm readout, but hind site is 20/20. This would have been helpful for setting full advance and to verify what rpm it was fully advanced at.
customer_reviews.author: Tony W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool
customer_reviews.text: So glad to gave researched replacement timing lights once the good ol good one gave up the ghost. This thing is on a completely different level. And Innova fully supports the product via their website.
customer_reviews.author: fd

customer_reviews.title: Instruction manual too brief!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice device a bit bulky but workable. The instructions are not detailed enough which necessitated few wasted minutes on the web looking for "How to" setup the device. I should have bought the simpler version of this device
customer_reviews.author: Mondherius

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I used it on my Mopar 383 with standard electronic ignition and it worked great. Set the timing, checked the RPM accuracy of the Tach. Was probably over kill for me as a hobbyist, but I can help out friends as needed.
customer_reviews.author: SpeedD408

customer_reviews.title: 10mm plug wires
customer_reviews.text: Innova 3551- I was worried about it fitting over and /or picking up the signal thru my 10mm plug wires. Not only did it fit, but it had room to spare and it picked up the spark with no problems at all! I had my '87 Chevy truck timed in about 15minutes. VERY HAPPY with this light!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Took all of 30 seconds to hook up and within a few minutes i was able to set my timing on my tbi 350 to 0 degress exactly. Just make sure the clamp on the plug wire is fully secured or youll get a inaccurate flash. This is a review for the cheapest one in this series. Glad to have it in my collection.
customer_reviews.author: CM530

customer_reviews.title: Good item but decription needs updating
customer_reviews.text: Received the unit and plugged in to use and realized that this unit cannot be hung on the wall as stated. Bottom now has a base that is a part of the unit and can no longer be hung, description should be changed, as this was a reason I purchased. Item is accurate and is nice to have the information it provides. Atomic clock function must be turned on which should be automatic but is listed as RCC function in manual.
customer_reviews.author: erik von kohler

customer_reviews.title: Works fine as a normal timing light
customer_reviews.text: Advance function does not work. Not worth the hassle to return. Works fine as a normal timing light, but the advance is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Brady

customer_reviews.title: Quality of product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this timing light 3 yrs ago because was rated number 1 among all the other timing lights. I used it only one time then stored it for 3 years. I took it out to use it a few days ago and it did not work. Called tech support about the problem was told I need to send it in and will cost $90 just to look at it.
customer_reviews.author: Al N.

customer_reviews.title: Light works great - Caution Hot Engines
customer_reviews.text: I've used the timing light twice and was disappointed the second time because the heat from the heater hose next to the spark plug wire caused it to warp. Never had that issue with my other timing light that has a thicker casing. Now it looks like I will have to buy a new harness. :(
customer_reviews.author: Johan M. Gallo

customer_reviews.title: The description for this was a bit vague and the instructions that come with it are even worse.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work on two strokes. The reviews for this seem to be a jumbled up mess of all the different models. The most expensive model apparently does do two strokes. The description for this was a bit vague and the instructions that come with it are even worse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly, very happy
customer_reviews.text: I needed to set the timing on my ‘87 4runner with a 22re. This involves setting the idle to 750 rpm and then jumping two terminals in a diagnostic port to drop the idle 100 rpms, and then setting the timing. The 3568 digital light allowed me to do this, and recheck after adjustments. It was so simple to use, I didn’t even have to change any of the settings, and it didn’t take me long at all. I am very happy with the light and I hope it works the next time I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works poorly at any engine speed above idle
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. This timing light will not fire on every spark event above idle, even on a single-fire motorcycle engine ignition (firing once every 720 crankshaft degrees). Fires only sporadically, and sometimes not at all, at 3,000 RPM, which is where I need to verify full-advance timing. A piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 15 minutes then quit. Upon inspection discovered that inductive pickup was melted.and ruined. What kind or design is it that makes a part that must be used next to hot exhaust manifolds out of fusible plastic??? Do not by INOVA! This is my third. Bought one that worked for a year, then another,to replace it, that stooped working after 1/2 hour. this one was an exchange replacement. I'm done! Thought this would be a good tool. Boy! Was I wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Randell Farris

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool.  Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this on a 1966 Mustang 200CID engine with original conventional ignition. The timing light works great. The dwell function is acceptable, but somewhat quirky. The meter displays a number and locks in to it, it remains constant. If I disconnect and reconnect the leads, I get a slightly different reading. I just average several readings and go with that number.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, love it, love the digital tach
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Worked perfectly first time. Love the built in the digital tach and the backlight. The manual is short and concise. The only tricky part was figuring out how to put it into two stroke mode, the manual isn't organized in a way that makes sense to me, so I just had to read straight through until I found it, which only took a couple of minutes (have to press two buttons at once; in hindsight the icons on the buttons did suggest this).
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Ok light
customer_reviews.text: Ok so the light works... only problem is it’s cheaply made. I dropped it from about waist high and it exploded. It was extremely brittle plastic. It still works but I had to electrical tape it together and it’s not pretty
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a malfunctioning light with advance. Within a minute I knew i had the right tool and it was made really well. My 1978 Mercury doesn't have a million sensors or computers to set and check engine ignition timing, its up to a skilled person with the right tool. It is running great now.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great timing light for the money, handy for the situations where there is only a single mark on the balancer and the timing cover and no other timing marks, I was able to set the gun to 8o BTDC and just line up the 2 marks on my boat engine since there was no timing tab on the timing cover.
customer_reviews.author: Kev D.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Worked for 15 minutes or so, then nothing.... going back to Amazon. While it worked it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: PaulSK

customer_reviews.title: Top notch equipment
customer_reviews.text: Worth the extra few bucks to have a dwel test feature. But for those who have never used a timing gun keep in mind this does not come with any instructions. Mfg said “go on line and down load them.”
customer_reviews.author: 69 Camaro

customer_reviews.title: 1991 miata
customer_reviews.text: Great timing light. Perfect for timing my 1991 Miata. Works perfectly. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ball

customer_reviews.title: Read below...
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. Although it is cheaply manufactured. Appears to be more from medium grade plastic. Great for a DIY. Sorta guy. Definitely wouldn't be taking it into a war zone but it would survive a airsoft battle. So long as you dont go using it as a battle axe.
customer_reviews.author: GATOR GITER CAJUN

customer_reviews.title: Worked until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: Lasted for a few instances of setting the timing... stopped working without notice.
customer_reviews.author: N. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great on my Honda Civic and was able to trigger on the signal wire for #1 COP. Also allows adjusting the timing advance to line up the TDC mark. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Has a good build quality feel
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Has a good build quality feel. The digital read out is perfect. You can turn the light on/off. The Tach readout is a great feature. So it's a timing light and tach tool which allows you to set idle speeds. I used it on my TBI K5, perfect tool for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Baker

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Worked OK for a couple of months but then went into a death spiral with inconsistent and/or incorrect results and erratic display and then finally nothing. Totally useless and a complete waste of money. Absolute piece of junk. I tried to return it without success. Threw it in the garbage. Will never buy from this company again. Went out and bought a simpler timing light from the local auto parts store at a fraction of the price. Don't waste your money on this piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: John Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Arrived open, repackaged and broken.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a lot for me to believe someone reasonably looked at this item, placed it into a box and shipped it to a paying customer. You have got to be kidding me. I have no idea how it functions, returned. We shall see how the replacement does. I will update the review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: SJohn

customer_reviews.title: Nice timing light
customer_reviews.text: Nice timing light. After several uses I feel like I should have bought the digital one though. I have a suspicion this one is off a degree or two. I can work around it but it's still irritating. Pretty durable though and the detaching cords make it easy to store
customer_reviews.author: The big tuna lv

customer_reviews.title: Good, but needs better instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Does well for the most part on my old Corvettes. But the dwell is not always accurate. And sometimes doesn't match with my old analog dwell meter. Also, theres very little instructions on how to use it. The green clamp wire isn't even mentioned in the manual (it connects to the iginiton coil to check dwell). YouTube is helpful in learning how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Innova light very convinient.
customer_reviews.text: Timing light works very well. If you are a technician. Is a must have tool. I would strongly recommend it, if you are into engine performance diagnostic you must have it.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Clearly item was used, not new
customer_reviews.text: So item description red the item was new. Other wise im sure if it was posted as used the price would be lower.. Item showed up with wear marks, and some obvious use. Works exactly as expected, low rating is due to the misrepresentation of the items condition
customer_reviews.author: Ellodarkness

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Have a 67 Camaro with new SBC 350 engine. Have an old timing light, and tack/dwell meter. Also tried spear tack I had laying around. No real help. Was able to time engine under 1000 rpm, but had trouble timing at 3500 rpm. Bought this to set both timings, and just ease of setup. Worked great. Easy to use. Light was not an issue. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nieves

customer_reviews.title: A little more confusing than it should be
customer_reviews.text: Who uses a timing light daily? If you don't, you're gonna have to dig out the instructions each time so don't loose em. They should have spent more time refining the user interface, this could (and should) be a lot more intuitive
customer_reviews.author: Gen4ten

customer_reviews.title: Failed within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great but the unit failed within 2 months of light use on my personal car I was tuning. It just stopped flashing and we tried it on various other vehicles without success.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Dim, works intermittently, sometimes double flashes.
customer_reviews.text: Worthless in my opinion. The light was very dim. Sometimes it would flash once then not at all. Also, at one point when it was 'sort of' working (during engine crank, not running) it would double flash every other time.
customer_reviews.author: A. Coscione

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: It works like it supposed to, buT if clearly made very cheaply. It’s way lighter than you would expect. The plastic is very thin and Weak. Everyone I hold it I’m worried it will break in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Timing Gun!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this timing light for over five years now, and it is still going strong. I use it on a bunch of my old muscle cars, and love how user friendly it is. The tachometer display really comes in handy, and allows for easier adjustment. I've read about some folks having issues with this timing gun, and MSD ignition systems, but have yet to try it on a car with an MSD box. Other then that, this is a great quality timing gun and comes with a really nice storage case for it. It's really easy to use. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Jordan Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Timing Light
customer_reviews.text: Significant improvement vs. the basic Harbor Freight advance timing light. Strobe is bright and easy to see with no "misses". Instructions are not the best, but the icons are pretty intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Sooner613

customer_reviews.title: Very Accuracy , shining flash light .
customer_reviews.text: Very Accuracy special the manual control advanced degree on vehicle need to but the ECU on adjustable mode . The flash is very shining . RPM Accurate reading .
customer_reviews.author: Mahmoud

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a total of 16 units over 3 orders. The timing light is well made, comes in a molded case and has the functions of timing, dwell, rpm's and voltage. The digital timing advance is a must for timing engines that do not have timing marks or have had the balancer improperly installed. I put these in service with my field mechanics and have had no problems with them at all. The orders were always correct, on-time and well packaged. Similar products sell for around $300 from the tool trucks. I will buy more if I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Superman

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Strob light is very bright, very ergonomic, the leads are more than long enough, and I like the screen size and interface functions. Good piece of equip. for the DIY or Pro
customer_reviews.author: Harry L-L

customer_reviews.title: and this unit is excellent for working on older cars where dwell
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought a cheaper unit, and after working twice and then failing, Amazon allowed me to return it and I spent a little more money and bought this unit. I work on old VW Beetles, and this unit is excellent for working on older cars where dwell, RPM and TIMING can all be displayed on the unit. It shows the actual RPM's while you are adjusting the timing which makes it all so simple. The components also seem more heavy duty and it seemed very accurate on the RPM's. My advice, spend a little more money and buy this unit- FANTASTIC!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: michael st john

customer_reviews.title: Really good Timing Light for experienced for experienced DIY'r
customer_reviews.text: Timing light works as it should and feels pretty sturdy, well made. Included instructions are clear and easy to follow (not that it's too hard to use). Having the embedded tachometer is really helpful for setting idle after adjusting the timing. Only complaint: I wish it came with a case.
customer_reviews.author: James UTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: Seems like good quality, nice case. Wires are a little all over the place but I'm glad I got it, I still run into distributors every once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December of 2018. I used it 2 maybe 3 times. Put it in my toolbox away from sun, dirt, and elements. Tried to use it May 2020 and it was broken. I called tech support and they said of course they could fix it but since it was longer than a year since I bought it I would need to pay $69.99 for the repair. I only use it 2or 3 times and it broke that quickly, disappointed in product and warranty.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: The Innova is nicely made, easy to use and the instruction booklet ...
customer_reviews.text: I have recently completed a restoration of my 1980 MGB, which I have owned for 27 years. I did most of the work myself but had a service shop "professionally" set the ignition timing and do other things at a cost $$$. Although the B ran well at idle, I was convinced that its timing was out and causing a lack of power and overheating. I bought the Innova 5568 to reset the timing myself. The Innova is nicely made, easy to use and the instruction booklet is explicit. Very pleased with this purchase - the only hassle is the B's battery sits behind the driver's seat and so I had to make a plan with the power connection.
customer_reviews.author: Angus

customer_reviews.title: Worked once
customer_reviews.text: Worked once. next day went to use it and the bulb stopped working. Still reading rpm just no light output.
customer_reviews.author: James A

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT LAST
customer_reviews.text: ..used this timing light twice with success.. third use was no good.. hooked up properly and noticed erratic flashing before vehicle was running! ..passed the return time limit and now throwing the innova 3551 inductive timing light in the trash and using my 30 year old american made timing light which still works fine
customer_reviews.author: tominob

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable.  Does not last.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working in less than a week. If you think that spending more for a quality item is not worth, it then think what it's like to waist your money on this cheep junk. I would pay three times as much if it would last.
customer_reviews.author: A. Braukman

customer_reviews.title: Case included.
customer_reviews.text: Like any other timing light, But Backlit, has rpm and timing degrees at same time. And it comes with a case. If dont have a fully index crankshaft pulley, this will allow you to pinpoint the exact degree if you are over your stock timing marks. Much easier then my old craftsman advance knob timing light. I liked it and gave it to my son, Koa.
customer_reviews.author: Keoki

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This item has a bright light, allowing easy visualization of timing marks. It also shows rpm, so that use of a tachometer is not necessary. This item has allowed me to easily map the timing curve of my 1965 Chevrolet big block motor.
customer_reviews.author: TDI Ted

customer_reviews.title: Great price and features!
customer_reviews.text: Description does not list how long the leaders are. Each leader is 6ft. Bought this to replace a SnapOn timing light that was purchased in 1988. Like the handle and that it pivots.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Basic Timing Light. Easy. Bright
customer_reviews.text: Used on Toyota v6. Timing instructions under hood. Hooked up light very easily. Started car and pointed light. Sunny day but marks were easily visible. Made a slight adjustment and used light again to double check. Quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L Sibert

customer_reviews.title: worked flawlessly nice cables
customer_reviews.text: used to check my 3.0 on the boat, found the tach on boat was off, was able to check my advance as well , full sun i could see my marks just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Just opened up the box today. The package for this timing light had been taped back together. The metal inductor was all scratched up and appeared to already have been used. This product didn't work right out of the box. After waiting a week to receive this item which I needed. I received a second hand piece of junk that nobody verified that it even worked.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out of the box on first use.
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of the timing. The functionality is a great idea. But the fact that on the first use the strobe didn't work or even turn on via the LCD screen is pretty unacceptable. Of all the functions to fail on a timing light, I feel like not being able to check timing is kinda sad. If there is a function I missed while reading the manual please let me know and I'll delete my review, or amend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hobbyist model
customer_reviews.text: Pretty basic model here. No too many bells or whistles to judge here. Works excellent without the costly extras.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! This is my first timing light and based on what it is capable of it will be the only one I will ever need. Easy to use. Easy to follow instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: ZzyzxRd

customer_reviews.title: work awesome
customer_reviews.text: so if you want a timing light that work great this is it... If you look around you will find others that look the same but with a big name on it .. So if you want to save 50 buck get this one .. I did and im happy .. And it came in a case to keep it safe for the next time i need to time a motor and to hold other items like chalk to mark the TDC ..
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: bought it in oct
customer_reviews.text: bought it in Oct. worked good go to use it now in march no display no light beware it may be great for a while then junk
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Fans

customer_reviews.title: good entry level
customer_reviews.text: this is a basic entry level timing gun. no special functions just shoots the light. but you get what you pay for with tools generally speaking. I bought this mostly just to mess with a project car. I would recommend spending a little more to get one to set advance and retard. But if all your looking for is a cheap timing gun to get you close this is for you. could have given 5 stars if there was some sort of case
customer_reviews.author: Alea gentile

product_meta.title: INNOVA 5568 Pro-Timing Light with Tool Case
product_meta.description: Style:Digital ProThe INNOVA Pro Digital Timing Light is the professional choice for a high quality timing light that will stand up daily shop use. Made from a heavy-duty, ABS, shock proof housing it has a molded boot for extra protection against the engine fan blades and a backlit screen for easier viewing in hard to see places. The slim, rotating barrel offers better aim at the timing mark. The four function digital readout includes tachometer ranges from 249-9,990 RPM, Advance Degrees (2 and 4 cycle) 0-90 degrees, dwell (2-12 cylinders) from 0-180 degrees and voltage from 10-16 volts DC. Features Patented Skip Circuitry Test up to 9,990 RPM and switches from 2-cycle to 4-cycle. This timing light works with most ignition systems (DIS, conventional, electronic and computer controlled systems - domestic and import). The INNOVA Pro Digital Timing Light includes detachable 6-foot leads with inductive pickup and a plastic storage case.
feature_bullets: Four function digital readout: Tachometer; Advance; Dwell; and Voltage
Patented Skip Circuitry Test up to 9,990 RPM
Heavy-duty shock proof housing features a molded boot for extra protection against the fan blades
